column7: Inversand Company pit / Edelman Fossil Park, Sewell (Navesink)
column26: Inversand Company marl pit at Sewell, Mantua Township. Quarrying began in the 1920s and ceased in 2015, at which time the site became the Jean and Ric Edelman Fossil Park quarry (EFPQ) at Rowan University.

column7: Inversand Company pit / Edelman Fossil Park, Sewell (MFL)

column7: Inversand Company pit / Edelman Fossil Park, Sewell (middle Hornerstown)
column26: Inversand Company marl pit at Sewell, Mantua Township. Quarrying began in the 1920s and ceased in 2015, at which time the site became the Jean and Ric Edelman Fossil Park quarry (EFPQ) at Rowan University.
column29: Harris et al. (2010) inferred water depths of ~80 m for the Hornerstown in drillcore samples from New Jersey, consistent with grain size and foram interpretations by Adams (1963) for more proximal outcrop sections ("relatively shallow water, probably less than 300 feet"). This could represent an offshore transition environment, although there are no obvious indicators of storm waves. The extreme abundance of glauconite is consistent with largely-quiet conditions, so an offshore environment is tentatively assigned.
